pull.title: clang-format: modernize and realign clang-format configuration

events.message:
clang-format: modernize `BreakConstructorInitializersBeforeComma` rule

See: https://github.com/llvm/llvm-project/blob/b8bda9d446e756f1ec722a06d604a654b472e581/clang/lib/Format/Format.cpp#L942-L943

Note that this is the default value anyway, so it will be removed later:
```
clang-format -dump-config -style='{Language: Cpp}' | grep BreakConstructorInitializers
BreakConstructorInitializers: BeforeColon
```

clang-format: modernize `IndentFunctionDeclarationAfterType` rule

See: https://github.com/llvm/llvm-project/blob/b8bda9d446e756f1ec722a06d604a654b472e581/clang/lib/Format/Format.cpp#L952C28-L952C54

Note that this is the default value anyway, so it will be removed later:
```
clang-format -dump-config -style='{Language: Cpp}' | grep IndentWrappedFunctionNames
IndentWrappedFunctionNames: false
```

scripted-diff: clang-format: remove default values from .clang-format

Remove redundant lines that match clang-format's built-in defaults.

-BEGIN VERIFY SCRIPT-
python3 -c "import subprocess
def merge_indented_lines(lines):
  merged = []
  for line in lines:
      if line.startswith(' '): merged[-1] += '|' + line
      else: merged.append(line)
  return merged
default_lines = set(merge_indented_lines(subprocess.run(['clang-format', '-dump-config', '-style={Language: Cpp}'], capture_output=True, text=True).stdout.split('\n')))
current_lines = merge_indented_lines(open('src/.clang-format').read().split('\n'))
kept_lines = [block for block in current_lines if block not in default_lines]
with open('src/.clang-format', 'w') as f: f.write('\n'.join(block.replace('|', '\n') for block in kept_lines))"
-END VERIFY SCRIPT-

scripted-diff: clang-format: regenerate, modernize deprecated configs

Regenerate `.clang-format` to replace deprecated option names with modern equivalents, preserving only the originally configured keys.

-BEGIN VERIFY SCRIPT-
python3 -c "import subprocess,re
def merge_indented_lines(lines):
  merged = []
  for line in lines:
      if line.startswith(' '): merged[-1] += '|' + line
      else: merged.append(line)
  return merged
keys_pattern = '|'.join(sorted({line.split(':')[0].strip() for line in open('src/.clang-format') if ':' in line and line.split(':')[0].strip()}))
regenerated_lines = merge_indented_lines(subprocess.run(['clang-format', '-dump-config', '-style=file:src/.clang-format'], capture_output=True, text=True).stdout.split('\n'))
filtered_lines = [block for block in regenerated_lines if re.match(f'^({keys_pattern}):', block)]
with open('src/.clang-format', 'w') as f: f.write('\n'.join(block.replace('|', '\n') for block in filtered_lines))"
-END VERIFY SCRIPT-

comments.body: a666d8ab6f3c019a9f7e184beb9b90affbb8075c: not sure about removing the default values. I don't think there is any harm in having them. In fact, we don't want this to silently change from down under with the next clang update.
7dda3d2c0e65ac1fa08ac3b24a13f2005c6bef1a: not sure about changing the values. seems fine to just keep the old value, which will likely work forever in a backward compatible way

comments.body: I'd say the others are probably edge cases to not matter much, but no strong opinion. Seems fine to add them as well to avoid silent changes. However, I don't think the config is forward compatible, so it can probably only contain keys of the minimum required clang version.
